answers.answer: Hi,Itching is usually associated with allergy.Since both you and your wife are experiencing the same thing it could be due to a common cause.It could be dust-mites or any change in bedlinen-anything new?For itching you could try OTC anti-histamines.Apart from this if burning sensation is more then it could be peripheral neuritis-it is the inflammation of outlying nerves. It affects nerves and muscles in the arms and legs.Itis usually a "pins and needles" type pain. This condition can occur at any age, but is most common in men between ages 30 and 50.Causes of peripheral neuritis include:* alcoholism,* long term chemical poisoning,* infectious diseases,* gout,* chronic diseases such as diabetes, arthritis, lupus,* B-12 deficiency, and* poor nutrition.You cpould take VitBcomplex supplements and see if your condition improves.If you still believe it is due to STD/AIDS you will have to keep taking tests to confirm your suspicion.
